facts: Psalms is a book of 150 songs and prayers that people in ancient Israel used for worship.
Many psalms are linked to King David, but they were written by several different authors over many years.
The Psalms include many emotions, such as joy, fear, sadness, and gratitude, showing that prayer can be honest and personal.
Proverbs is a collection of short sayings that teach wisdom and good choices for everyday life.
A major theme in Proverbs is that respecting and listening to God is the beginning of true wisdom.
Proverbs often uses comparisons and word pictures to help readers remember lessons about speech, work, friends, and self-control.
Both Psalms and Proverbs are part of the Bible’s Wisdom Books, which focus on living well and understanding God’s guidance.
sources_hint: You can verify these facts by checking the Bible’s tables of contents and introductions for Psalms and Proverbs in a study Bible or a trusted Bible encyclopedia.
